DAY-ta or DA-ta

1.16.22  9:38 pm   what are the qualities of someone you look up to

      they'd be higher than me

1.16.22  9:21 pm   i've got a question

      well you came to the right place

1.16.22  5:38 pm   when you write a song, what's your thought process?

     "don't think"... "fuck, i just noticed myself thinking 'don't think' so i already fucked it up, and that must be why nothing's happening. it was going great before i started thinking. eventually as soon as i stop thinking, it will get good again. but it's hard to know when that was or will be because i wouldn't be thinking at the time"

     is it similar every song?

     yes, it's usually periods of thinking and not thinking, and whenever i'm thinking, nothing works. and whenever i'm not thinking, everything works beautifully and the songwriting pretty much occurs at the speed of the song

     do you think of a chord progression first, lyrics first, etc.

     absolutely not. those would be examples of the 'thinking' method, which mostly does not seem to work or produce any results whatsoever. it's kind of like if you tried to say a sentence with all the A's first, then all the B's, etc

      already being there

      i have a lot of videos of myself doing it, but there's 2 problems with that, for your purposes: it's not collaborative and it also might not be released until the year 2099

      don't worry about it. don't use them until you want to

1.15.22  2:00 am   What was the thought behind the line "it's 1900 and the times are going to change"?

      thinking about time and changes over the course of 10s or even 100s of years into the future. certainly there must have already been a feeling in 1900 that times were going to change, with rapidly developing new technologies. sound recordings, video, radio, cars, many more things. it's similar to the feeling we've been having ever since, with telephones, computers, planes, ai, many more things. By placing this in 1900, it's giving you an alternate view of the same story from an earlier point in time, and it also gives you the listener the sensation of actually being in the future, as you are listening to it more than 100 years later. so it hopefully rings especially true that times did change and indeed still are

1.15.22  1:15 am   What should I do if I'm an artist but none of my friends approve of art?

      stop submitting it to them for approval

1.14.22  9:57 pm   In Got Some Money, the lyrics describe a hotel with a plane in which the window is broken, allowing cold wind to enter.
In Outside, there is a hotel opened on the tundra (usually cold) in which a stick figure is shown entering through the window. The song also mentions leaving on a plane immediately after.
Do the two songs describe the same hotel?

      i doubt it
